arabicText: ۞ وَمَن يَقْنُتْ مِنكُنَّ لِلَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦ وَتَعْمَلْ صَـٰلِحًۭا نُّؤْتِهَآ أَجْرَهَا مَرَّتَيْنِ وَأَعْتَدْنَا لَهَا رِزْقًۭا كَرِيمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	whoever	among	you	remains	
obedient	towards	Allah	and	His	Noble	
Messenger	and	does	good	deeds	-	We	
shall	give	her	double	the	reward	of	others,	
and	have	kept	prepared	for	her	an	
honourable	sustenance.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jo	tum	meiñ	farmāñ-bardār	rahe	Allah		
aur	Rasool	ki	aur	achchā	kām	kare	ham	
usey	auroñ	se	donā	(dugnā)	swab	deñ	ge	
aur	ham	ne	us	ke	liye	‘izzal	ki	rozi	tayyār	
kar	rakhi	hai.

arabicText: يَـٰنِسَآءَ ٱلنَّبِىِّ لَسْتُنَّ كَأَحَدٍۢ مِّنَ ٱلنِّسَآءِ ۚ إِنِ ٱتَّقَيْتُنَّ فَلَا تَخْضَعْنَ بِٱلْقَوْلِ فَيَطْمَعَ ٱلَّذِى فِى قَلْبِهِۦ مَرَضٌۭ وَقُلْنَ قَوْلًۭا مَّعْرُوفًۭا
englishTranslationText:
O	the	wives	of	the	Prophet!	You	are	not	
like	any	other	women	-	if	you	really	fear	
Allah,	do	not	speak	softly	lest	the	one	in	
whose	heart	is	a	disease	have	any	
inclination,	and	speak	fairly.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Nabi	ki	bibiyo!	Tum	aur	‘auratoñ	ki	
ṭaraḥ	nahiñ	ho	agar	Allāh	se	daro	to	bāt	
meiñ	aisi	narmi	na	karo	ke	dil	ka	rogi	
kuchh	lālach	kare	hāñ	achchi	bāt	kaho.

arabicText: وَقَرْنَ فِى بُيُوتِكُنَّ وَلَا تَبَرَّجْنَ تَبَرُّجَ ٱلْجَـٰهِلِيَّةِ ٱلْأُولَىٰ ۖ وَأَقِمْنَ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتِينَ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَأَطِعْنَ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥٓ ۚ إِنَّمَا يُرِيدُ ٱللَّهُ لِيُذْهِبَ عَنكُمُ ٱلرِّجْسَ أَهْلَ ٱلْبَيْتِ وَيُطَهِّرَكُمْ تَطْهِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	remain	in	your	houses	and	do	not	
unveil	yourselves	like	the	unveiling	
prevalent	in	the	times	of	ignorance,	and	
keep	the	prayer	established,	and	pay	the	
charity,	and	obey	Allah	and	His	Noble	
Messenger;	Allah	only	wills	to	remove	all	
impurity	from	you,	O	the	People	of	the	
Household,	and	by	cleansing	you	make	
you	utterly	pure.	(*The	Holy	Prophet’s	
household.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	apne	gharoñ	meiñ	thahri	raho	aur	be
pardah	na	raho	jaise	agli	jāhiliyat	ki	be
pardagi	aur	Namāz	qāim	rakho,	aur	Zakāt	
do,	aur	Allāh	aur	us	ke	Rasool	ka	ḥukm	
māno;	Allāh	to	yahi	chāhtā	hai,	aey	Nabi	ke	
ghar	wālo,	ke	tum	se	har	nāpāki	door	
farmā	de,	aur	tumheñ	Pāk	kar	ke	khoob	
suthrā	kar	de.

arabicText: وَٱذْكُرْنَ مَا يُتْلَىٰ فِى بُيُوتِكُنَّ مِنْ ءَايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ وَٱلْحِكْمَةِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ لَطِيفًا خَبِيرًا
englishTranslationText:
And	remember	what	is	recited	in	your	
houses,	from	Allah’s	verses	and	wisdom*;	
indeed	Allah	knows	the	minutest	things,	is	
All	Aware.	(The	Holy	Qur’an	and	the	
sayings-	hadith	-	of	the	Holy	Prophet.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	yād	karo	jo	tumhāre	gharoñ	meiñ	
padhi	jāti	haiñ	Allāh	ki	Āayateñ	aur	
Hikmat	be-shak	Allāh	har	bāriki	jānta	
khabar-dār	hai.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلْمُسْلِمِينَ وَٱلْمُسْلِمَـٰتِ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنَـٰتِ وَٱلْقَـٰنِتِينَ وَٱلْقَـٰنِتَـٰتِ وَٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ وَٱلصَّـٰدِقَـٰتِ وَٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ وَٱلصَّـٰبِرَٰتِ وَٱلْخَـٰشِعِينَ وَٱلْخَـٰشِعَـٰتِ وَٱلْمُتَصَدِّقِينَ وَٱلْمُتَصَدِّقَـٰتِ وَٱلصَّـٰٓئِمِينَ وَٱلصَّـٰٓئِمَـٰتِ وَٱلْحَـٰفِظِينَ فُرُوجَهُمْ وَٱلْحَـٰفِظَـٰتِ وَٱلذَّٰكِرِينَ ٱللَّهَ كَثِيرًۭا وَٱلذَّٰكِرَٰتِ أَعَدَّ ٱللَّهُ لَهُم مَّغْفِرَةًۭ وَأَجْرًا عَظِيمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	the	Muslim	men	and	the	Muslim	women,	and	the	believing	men	and	the	believing	
women,	and	the	obedient	men	and	the	obedient	women,	and	the	truthful	men	and	the	truthful	
women,	and	the	patient	men	and	the	patient	women,	and	the	humble	men	and	the	humble	
women,	and	the	charitable	men	and	the	charitable	women,	and	the	fasting	men	and	the	fasting	
women,	and	the	men	who	guard	their	chastity	and	the	women	who	guard	their	chastity,	and	the	
men	who	profusely	remember	Allah	and	the	women	who	profusely	remember	Allah	–	for	all	of	
them,	Allah	has	kept	prepared	forgiveness	and	an	immense	reward.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	Musalmān	mard	aur	Musalmān	‘aurateñ	aur	Imān	wāle	aur	Imān	wāliyāñ	aur	farmān
bardār	aur	farmā-bardāreñ	aur	sachche	aur	sachchiyāñ	aur	Sabr	wāle	aur	Sabr	wāliyāñ	aur	
‘āajizi	karne	wāle	aur	‘āajizi	karne	wāliyāñ	aur	Khairāt	karne	wāle	aur	Khairāt	karne	wāliyān	
aur	Roze	wāle	aur	oze	wāliyāñ	aur	apni pārsāyi	nigāh	rakhne	wāle	aur	nighāh	rakhne	wāliyāñ	
aur	Allāh	ko	bahut	yād	karne	wāle	aur	yād	karne	wāliyān	in	sab	ke	liye	Allāh	ne	bakhshish	aur	
badā	sawāb	tayyār		kar	rakhā	hai.

arabicText: إِوَمَا كَانَ لِمُؤْمِنٍۢ وَلَا مُؤْمِنَةٍ إِذَا قَضَى ٱللَّهُ وَرَسُولُهُۥٓ أَمْرًا أَن يَكُونَ لَهُمُ ٱلْخِيَرَةُ مِنْ أَمْرِهِمْ ۗ وَمَن يَعْصِ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ فَقَدْ ضَلَّ ضَلَـٰلًۭا مُّبِينًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	no	Muslim	man	or	woman	has	any	
right	in	the	affair,	when	Allah	and	His	
Noble	Messenger	have	decreed	a	
command	regarding	it;	and	whoever	does	
not	obey	the	command	of	Allah	and	His	
Noble	Messenger,	has	indeed	clearly	gone	
very	astray.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kisi	Musalmān	mard	na	Musalmān	
áurat	ko	pahuñchtā	hai	ke	jab	Allāh-o
Rasool	kuch	ḥukm	farmā	deñ	to	unheñ	
apne	mu’āamle	ka	kuchh	ikhtiyār	rahe	aur	
jo	ḥukm	na	māne	Allāh	aur	us	ke	Rasool		
ka	woh	be-shak	sariḥ	gumrāhi	bahkā.

arabicText: وَإِذْ تَقُولُ لِلَّذِىٓ أَنْعَمَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَأَنْعَمْتَ عَلَيْهِ أَمْسِكْ عَلَيْكَ زَوْجَكَ وَٱتَّقِ ٱللَّهَ وَتُخْفِى فِى نَفْسِكَ مَا ٱللَّهُ مُبْدِيهِ وَتَخْشَى ٱلنَّاسَ وَٱللَّهُ أَحَقُّ أَن تَخْشَىٰهُ ۖ فَلَمَّا قَضَىٰ زَيْدٌۭ مِّنْهَا وَطَرًۭا زَوَّجْنَـٰكَهَا لِكَىْ لَا يَكُونَ عَلَى ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ حَرَجٌۭ فِىٓ أَزْوَٰجِ أَدْعِيَآئِهِمْ إِذَا قَضَوْا۟ مِنْهُنَّ وَطَرًۭا ۚ وَكَانَ أَمْرُ ٱللَّهِ مَفْعُولًۭا ٣٧
englishTranslationText:
And	O	dear	Prophet,	remember	when	you	
said	to	him	upon	whom	Allah	has	
bestowed	favour	and	you	had	bestowed	
favour,	“Keep	your	wife	with	you,	and	fear	
Allah”,	and	you	kept	in	your	heart	what	
Allah	willed	to	make	known,	and	you	
feared	criticism	from	the	people;	and	
Allah	has	more	right	that	you	should	fear	
Him;	so	when	Zaid	became	unconcerned	
with	her,	We	gave	her	to	you	in	marriage,	
so	that	there	may	be	no	sin	upon	believers	
in	respect	of	the	wives	of	their	adopted	
sons	when	they	have	become	
unconcerned	with	them;	and	the	
command	of	Allah	must	be	carried	out.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	aey	Meḥboob	yād	karo	jab	tum	
farmāte	the	us	se	jise	Allāh	ne	ne’amat	di	
aur	tum	ne	usey	ne’amat	di	ke	apni	bibi	
pās	rahne	de	aur	Allāh	se	dar	aur	tum	
apne	dil	meiñ	rakhte	the	woh	jise	Allāh	ko	
zāhir	karnā	manzor	thā	aur	tumheñ	logoñ	
ke	ṭ’ane	ka	andesha	thā	aur	Allāh	ziyāda	
sazāwār	hai	ke	us	ka	khauf	rakho	phir	jab	
zaid	ki	gharz	us	se	nikal	gayi	to	ham	ne	
woh	tumhāre	nikāḥ	meiñ	de	di	ke	
musalmān	par	kuchh	ḥarj	na	rahe	un	ke	
le-palkoñ (muñh	bole	betoñ)	ki	bibiyoñ	
meiñ	jab	un	se	un	ka	kām	khatm	ho	jāye	
aur	Allāh	ka	ḥukm	ho	kar	rahnā.

arabicText: مَّا كَانَ عَلَى ٱلنَّبِىِّ مِنْ حَرَجٍۢ فِيمَا فَرَضَ ٱللَّهُ لَهُۥ ۖ سُنَّةَ ٱللَّهِ فِى ٱلَّذِينَ خَلَوْا۟ مِن قَبْلُ ۚ وَكَانَ أَمْرُ ٱللَّهِ قَدَرًۭا مَّقْدُورًا
englishTranslationText:
There	is	no	blame	upon	the	Prophet	
regarding	the	matter	that	Allah	has	
decreed	for	him;	it	has	been	Allah’s	
tradition	in	those	who	passed	before;	and	
the	command	of	Allah	is	a	certain	destiny.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Nabi	par	koyi	ḥaraj	nahiñ	is	bāt	meiñ	jo	
Allāh	ne	us	ke	liye	muqarrar	farmāyi	Allāh	
ka	dastoor	chalā	āa	rahā	hai	un	meiñ	jo	
pahle	guzar	chuke	aur	Allāh	ka	kām	
muqarrar	taqdir	hai.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ يُبَلِّغُونَ رِسَـٰلَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ وَيَخْشَوْنَهُۥ وَلَا يَخْشَوْنَ أَحَدًا إِلَّا ٱللَّهَ ۗ وَكَفَىٰ بِٱللَّهِ حَسِيبًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Those	who	deliver	the	messages	of	Allah	
and	fear	Him,	and	do	not	fear	anyone	
except	Allah;	and	Allah	is	Sufficient	to	take	
account.
romanUrduTranslationText:
woh jo	Allāh	ke	payām	pahuñchāte	aur	us	se	darte	aur	Allāh	ke	siwā	kisi kā	khauf	na	karte	aur	
Allāh	bas	(kāfi)	hai	ḥisāb	lene	wālā.

arabicText: مَّا كَانَ مُحَمَّدٌ أَبَآ أَحَدٍۢ مِّن رِّجَالِكُمْ وَلَـٰكِن رَّسُولَ ٱللَّهِ وَخَاتَمَ ٱلنَّبِيِّـۧنَ ۗ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَىْءٍ عَلِيمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Muhammad	(peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him)	is	not	the	father	of	any	man	among	you	–	but	he	
is	the	Noble	Messenger	of	Allah	and	the	Last	of	the	Prophets	*;	and	Allah	knows	all	things.	(* 
Prophet Muhammad – peace and blessings be upon him – is the Last Prophet. There can be 
no new Prophet after him).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Muḥammad	tumhāre	mardoñ	meiñ	kisi	ke	bāp	nahiñ	hāñ	Allāh	ke	Rasool	haiñ	aur	sab	Nabiyoñ	
meiñ	pichle	aur	Allāh	sab	kuchh	jānta	hai.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱذْكُرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ ذِكْرًۭا كَثِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText: O	People	who	Believe!	Remember	Allah	profusely.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aey	Imān	wālo	Allāh	ko	bahut	yād	karo.

arabicText: وَسَبِّحُوهُ بُكْرَةًۭ وَأَصِيلًا
englishTranslationText: And	proclaim	His	Purity,	morning	and	evening.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	subḥ-o-sham	us	ki	pāki	bolo.

arabicText: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى يُصَلِّى عَلَيْكُمْ وَمَلَـٰٓئِكَتُهُۥ لِيُخْرِجَكُم مِّنَ ٱلظُّلُمَـٰتِ إِلَى ٱلنُّورِ ۚ وَكَانَ بِٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ رَحِيمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
It	is	He	Who	sends	blessings	upon	you	*,	and	so	do	His	angels,	so	that	He	may	bring	you	out	
from	darkness	into	light;	and	He	is	Most	Merciful	upon	the	Muslims.	(*	Upon	the	companions	of	
the	Holy	Prophet).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Wahi	hai	ke	Durood	bhejtā	hai	tum	par	Woh	aur	us	ke	Farishte	ke	tumheñ	andheriyoñ	se	ujāle	
ki	ṭaraf	nikāle	aur	woh	Musalmānoñ	par	maherbān	hai.

arabicText: تَحِيَّتُهُمْ يَوْمَ يَلْقَوْنَهُۥ سَلَـٰمٌۭ ۚ وَأَعَدَّ لَهُمْ أَجْرًۭا كَرِيمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
For	them	the	salutation	upon	their	
meeting	*	is	“Peace”;	and	an	honourable	
reward	is	kept	prepared	for	them.	(*	Upon	
death	/	while	entering	Paradise	/	meeting	
with	Allah).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	ke	liye	milte	waqt	ki	Du’ā	Salām	hai	
aur	un	ke	liye	‘izzal	ka	sawāb	tayyār	kar	
rakhā	hai.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّبِىُّ إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَـٰكَ شَـٰهِدًۭا وَمُبَشِّرًۭا وَنَذِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
O	Herald	of	the	Hidden!	We	have	indeed	
sent	you	as	an	observing	present	witness	
and	a	Herald	of	glad	tidings	and	warning.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Ghaib	ki	khabreñ	batāne	wāle (Nabi)	
be-shak	ham	ne	tumheñ	bhejā	ḥāzir	nāzir	
aur	khush-khabri	detā	aur	dar	sonata.

arabicText: وَدَاعِيًا إِلَى ٱللَّهِ بِإِذْنِهِۦ وَسِرَاجًۭا مُّنِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	as	a	caller	towards	Allah,	by	His	
command,	and	as	a	sun	that	enlightens.	
(The	Holy	Prophet	is	a	light	from	Allah.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Allāh	ki	ṭaraf	us	ke	ḥukm	se	bulātā	
aur	chamkā	dene	wālā	āaftāb.

arabicText: وَبَشِّرِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ بِأَنَّ لَهُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ فَضْلًۭا كَبِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	give	glad	tidings	to	the	believers	that	
for	them	is	Allah’s	extreme	munificence.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Imān	wāloñ	ko	khush-khabri	do	ke	un	
ke	liye	Allāh	ka	badā	fazl	hai.

arabicText: وَلَا تُطِعِ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ وَٱلْمُنَـٰفِقِينَ وَدَعْ أَذَىٰهُمْ وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَكَفَىٰ بِٱللَّهِ وَكِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	do	not	please	the	disbelievers	and	the	
hypocrites,	and	overlook	the	pain	they	
cause	and	rely	upon	Allah;	and	Allah	
suffices	as	a	Trustee.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kāfiroñ	aur	munāfiqoñ	ki	khushi	na	
karo	aur	un	ki	‘iƶā	par	dar-guzar	farmāō	
aur	Allāh	par	bharosa	karo	aur	Allāh	bas	
(kāfi)	hai	kār-sāz.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِذَا نَكَحْتُمُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنَـٰتِ ثُمَّ طَلَّقْتُمُوهُنَّ مِن قَبْلِ أَن تَمَسُّوهُنَّ فَمَا لَكُمْ عَلَيْهِنَّ مِنْ عِدَّةٍۢ تَعْتَدُّونَهَا ۖ فَمَتِّعُوهُنَّ وَسَرِّحُوهُنَّ سَرَاحًۭا جَمِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
O	People	who	Believe!	If	you	marry	
Muslim	women	and	divorce	them	without	
having	touched	them,	so	for	you	there	is	
no	waiting	period	for	the	women,	which	
you	may	count;	therefore	give	them	some	
benefit	and	release	them	with	a	proper	
release.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Imān	wālo	jab	tum	Musalmān	
‘auratoñ	se	nikāḥ	karo	phir	unheñ	be	hāth	
lagāye	chhod		do	to	tumhāre	liye	kuchh	
‘iddat	nahiñ	jise	gino	to	unheñ	kuchh	fāida	
do	aur	achchi	ṭaraḥ	se	chhod		do.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّبِىُّ إِنَّآ أَحْلَلْنَا لَكَ أَزْوَٰجَكَ ٱلَّـٰتِىٓ ءَاتَيْتَ أُجُورَهُنَّ وَمَا مَلَكَتْ يَمِينُكَ مِمَّآ أَفَآءَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْكَ وَبَنَاتِ عَمِّكَ وَبَنَاتِ عَمَّـٰتِكَ وَبَنَاتِ خَالِكَ وَبَنَاتِ خَـٰلَـٰتِكَ ٱلَّـٰتِى هَاجَرْنَ مَعَكَ وَٱمْرَأَةًۭ مُّؤْمِنَةً إِن وَهَبَتْ نَفْسَهَا لِلنَّبِىِّ إِنْ أَرَادَ ٱلنَّبِىُّ أَن يَسْتَنكِحَهَا خَالِصَةًۭ لَّكَ مِن دُونِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ ۗ قَدْ عَلِمْنَا مَا فَرَضْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ فِىٓ أَزْوَٰجِهِمْ وَمَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَـٰنُهُمْ لِكَيْلَا يَكُونَ عَلَيْكَ حَرَجٌۭ ۗ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ غَفُورًۭا رَّحِيمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
O	Herald	of	the	Hidden!	We	have	indeed	
made	lawful	for	you	the	wives	to	whom	
you	have	paid	their	bridal	money,	and	the	bondwomen	you	possess	whom	Allah	gave	you	as	
war	booty,	and	the	daughters	of	your	paternal	uncles,	and	the	daughters	of	your	paternal	aunts,	
and	the	daughters	of	your	maternal	uncles,	and	the	daughters	of	your	maternal	aunts,	those	
who	migrated	with	you;	and	the	believing	woman	if	she	gifts	her	life	to	the	Prophet,	if	the	
Prophet	desires	to	take	her	in	marriage;	this	is	exclusively	for	you,	not	for	your	followers;	We	
indeed	know	what	We	have	enjoined	upon	the	Muslims	concerning	their	wives	and	the	
bondwomen	they	possess	–	this	exclusivity	for	you	is	so	that	you	may	not	have	constraints;	and	
Allah	is	Oft	Forgiving,	Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Ghaib	Batāne	Wāle	(Nabi)	Hum	ne	
tumhāre	liye	ḥalāl	farmāyiñ	tumhāri	wo	
biwiyāñ	jinko	tum	maher	do	aur	tumhāre	
hāth	ka	māl	kanizeñ	jo	Allāh	ne	tumheñ	ghanimat	meiñ	diñ	aur	tumhāry	chachā	ki	betiyāñ	aur	
phupiyoñ	ki	betiyāñ	aur	māmuoñ	ki	betiyāñ	aur	khālāōñ	ki	betiyāñ	jinhoñ	ne	tumhāre	sāth	
hijrat	ki	aur	imān	wāli	'aurat	agar	woh	apni	jān	Nabi	ki	naƶar	kare	agar	nabi	usey	nikāḥ	meiñ	
lānā	chāhe	ye	khās	tumhāre	liye	hai	ummat	ke	liye	nahiñ	hameñ	m'aloom	hai	jo	ham	ne	
musalmānoñ	par	muqarrar	kiyā	hai	un	ki	bibiyoñ	aur	un	ke	hāth	ke	māl	kanizoñ	meiñ	ye	
khusosiyat	tumhāri	is	liye	ke	tum	par	koyi	tangi	na	ho	aur	Allāh	bakhsh	ne	wālā	maherbān.

arabicText: ۞ تُرْجِى مَن تَشَآءُ مِنْهُنَّ وَتُـْٔوِىٓ إِلَيْكَ مَن تَشَآءُ ۖ وَمَنِ ٱبْتَغَيْتَ مِمَّنْ عَزَلْتَ فَلَا جُنَاحَ عَلَيْكَ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ أَدْنَىٰٓ أَن تَقَرَّ أَعْيُنُهُنَّ وَلَا يَحْزَنَّ وَيَرْضَيْنَ بِمَآ ءَاتَيْتَهُنَّ كُلُّهُنَّ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ مَا فِى قُلُوبِكُمْ ۚ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ عَلِيمًا حَلِيمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Put	back	in	the	order	whom	you	wish	
among	them	and	give	your	proximity	to	
whomever	you	wish;	and	if	you	incline	
towards	one	whom	you	had	set	aside,	
there	is	no	sin	upon	you	in	it;	this	
command	is	closer	to	their	eyes	remaining	
soothed	and	not	grieving,	and	all	of	them	
remaining	happy	with	whatever	you	give	
them;	and	Allah	knows	what	is	in	the	
hearts	of	you	all;	and	Allah	is	All	Knowing,	
Most	Forbearing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Piche	hatāō	un	meiñ	se	jise	chāho	aur	
apne	pās	jagah	do	jise	chāho	aur	jise	tum	
ne	kināre	kar	diyā	thā	usey	tumhārā	jo	
chāhe	to	us	meiñ	bhi	tum	par	kuchh	
gunāh	nahiñ	ye	amr	is	se	nazdik	tar	hai	ke	
un	ki	āankheñ	thandi	hoñ	aur	gham	na	
kareñ	aur	tum	unheñ	jo	kuchh	'aṭā	farmāō	
is	per	woh	sab	ki	sab	rāzi	raheñ	aur	Allāh	
jānta	hai	jo	tum	sab	ke	diloñ	meiñ	hai	aur	
Allāh	'ilm-o-ḥilm	wālā	hai.

arabicText: لَّا يَحِلُّ لَكَ ٱلنِّسَآءُ مِنۢ بَعْدُ وَلَآ أَن تَبَدَّلَ بِهِنَّ مِنْ أَزْوَٰجٍۢ وَلَوْ أَعْجَبَكَ حُسْنُهُنَّ إِلَّا مَا مَلَكَتْ يَمِينُكَ ۗ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ رَّقِيبًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Other	women	are	not	permitted	for	you	
after	these,	nor	that	you	change	them	for	
other	wives	even	if	their	beauty	pleases	
you	except	the	bondwomen	whom	you	
possess;	and	Allah	is	the	Guardian	over	all	
things.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	ke	b'ad	aur	'aurateñ	tumheñ	Halāl	
nahiñ	aur	na	ye	ke	un	ke	'iwaz	aur	bibiyāñ	
badlo	agarche	tumheñ	un	ka	ḥusn	bhāye	
magar	kaniz	tumhāre	hāth	ka	māl	aur	
Allāh	har	chiz	par	nigehbān	hai.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لَا تَدْخُلُوا۟ بُيُوتَ ٱلنَّبِىِّ إِلَّآ أَن يُؤْذَنَ لَكُمْ إِلَىٰ طَعَامٍ غَيْرَ نَـٰظِرِينَ إِنَىٰهُ وَلَـٰكِنْ إِذَا دُعِيتُمْ فَٱدْخُلُوا۟ فَإِذَا طَعِمْتُمْ فَٱنتَشِرُوا۟ وَلَا مُسْتَـْٔنِسِينَ لِحَدِيثٍ ۚ إِنَّ ذَٰلِكُمْ كَانَ يُؤْذِى ٱلنَّبِىَّ فَيَسْتَحْىِۦ مِنكُمْ ۖ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يَسْتَحْىِۦ مِنَ ٱلْحَقِّ ۚ وَإِذَا سَأَلْتُمُوهُنَّ مَتَـٰعًۭا فَسْـَٔلُوهُنَّ مِن وَرَآءِ حِجَابٍۢ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ أَطْهَرُ لِقُلُوبِكُمْ وَقُلُوبِهِنَّ ۚ وَمَا كَانَ لَكُمْ أَن تُؤْذُوا۟ رَسُولَ ٱللَّهِ وَلَآ أَن تَنكِحُوٓا۟ أَزْوَٰجَهُۥ مِنۢ بَعْدِهِۦٓ أَبَدًا ۚ إِنَّ ذَٰلِكُمْ كَانَ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ عَظِيمًا
englishTranslationText:
O	People	who	Believe!	Do	not	enter	the	
houses	of	the	Prophet	without	
permission,	as	when	called	for	a	meal	but	
not	to	linger	around	waiting	for	it	–	and	if	
you	are	invited	then	certainly	present	
yourself	and	when	you	have	eaten,	
disperse	–	not	staying	around	delighting	
in	conversation;	indeed	that	was	causing	
harassment	to	the	Prophet,	and	he	was	
having	regard	for	you;	and	Allah	does	not	
shy	in	proclaiming	the	truth;	and	when	
you	ask	the	wives	of	the	Prophet	for	anything	to	use,	ask	for	it	from	behind	a	curtain;	this	is	
purer	for	your	hearts	and	for	their	hearts;	and	you	have	no	right	to	trouble	the	Noble	
Messenger	of	Allah,	nor	ever	marry	any	of	his	wives	after	him;	indeed	that	is	a	very	severe	
matter	in	the	sight	of	Allah.	(To	honour	the	Holy	Prophet	–	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him	–	is	
part	of	faith.	To	disrespect	him	is	blasphemy.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Imān	wālo	Nabi	ke	gharoñ	meiñ	na	
ḥāzir	ho	jab	tak	iƶn	na	pāō	maslan	khāne	
ke	liye	bulāye	jāō	na	yuñ	ke	khud	us	ke	
pakne	ki	rāh	tako	hān	jab	bulāye	jāō	to	ḥazir	ho	aur	jab	khā	chuko	to	mutfarriq	ho	jāō	na	ye	ke	
baithe	batoñ	meiñ	dil	bahlāō	be-shak	is	meiñ	Nabi	ko	iƶā	hoti	thi	to	woh	tumhārā	liḥāz	farmāte	
the	aur	Allāh	Haq	farmāne	meiñ	nahiñ	sharmātā	aur	jab	tum	un	se	baratne	ki	koyi	cheez	mañgo		
to	parde	ke	bāhar	se	mañgo	is	meiñ	ziyāda	suthrāyi	hai	tumhāre	diloñ	aur	un	ke	diloñ	ki	aur	
tumheñ	nahiñ	pahuñchtā	ke	Rasool-ul-Allāh	ko	iƶā	do	aur	na	ye	ke	in	ke	b'ad	kabhi	in	ki	bibiyoñ	
se	Nikāḥ	karo	be-shak	ye	Allāh	ke	nazdik	badi	sakht	bāt	hai.

arabicText: إِن تُبْدُوا۟ شَيْـًٔا أَوْ تُخْفُوهُ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ بِكُلِّ شَىْءٍ عَلِيمًۭا
englishTranslationText: Whether	you	disclose	a	thing	or	keep	it	hidden	–	then	indeed	Allah	knows	all	things.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	agar	tum	koyi	bāt	zāhir	karo	yā	chupāō	to	be-shak	Allāh	sab	kuchh	jānta	hai.

arabicText: لَّا جُنَاحَ عَلَيْهِنَّ فِىٓ ءَابَآئِهِنَّ وَلَآ أَبْنَآئِهِنَّ وَلَآ إِخْوَٰنِهِنَّ وَلَآ أَبْنَآءِ إِخْوَٰنِهِنَّ وَلَآ أَبْنَآءِ أَخَوَٰتِهِنَّ وَلَا نِسَآئِهِنَّ وَلَا مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَـٰنُهُنَّ ۗ وَٱتَّقِينَ ٱللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ شَهِيدًا
englishTranslationText:
There	is	no	sin	upon	your	wives	in	
(dealing	with)	their	fathers,	or	their	sons,	
or	their	brothers,	or	their	brothers’	sons,	
or	their	sisters’	sons	or	women	of	their	
own	religion,	or	their	bondwomen;	and	O	
women,	keep	fearing	Allah;	indeed	all	
things	are	present	in	front	of	Allah.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	par	muzāiqa	nahiñ	un	ke	bāp	aur	
betoñ	aur	bhāiyoñ	aur	bhatijoñ	aur	
bhānjoñ	aur	apne	Deen	ki	'auratoñ	aur	
apni	Kanizoñ	meiñ	aur	Allāh	se	darti	raho	
be-shak	har	chiz	Allāh	ke	sāmne	hai.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ وَمَلَـٰٓئِكَتَهُۥ يُصَلُّونَ عَلَى ٱلنَّبِىِّ ۚ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ صَلُّوا۟ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلِّمُوا۟ تَسْلِيمًا
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	Allah	and	His	angels	send	
blessings	on	the	Prophet;	O	People	who	
Believe!	Send	blessings	and	abundant	
salutations	upon	him.	(Everlasting	peace	
and	unlimited	blessings	be	upon	the	Holy	
Prophet	Muhammad.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	Allāh	aur	us	ke	Farishte	Durood	
bhejte	haiñ	us	Ghaib	batāne	wāle	(Nabi)	
par	aey	Imān	wālo	un	par	durood	aur	
khoob	Salām	bhejo.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يُؤْذُونَ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ لَعَنَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا وَٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ وَأَعَدَّ لَهُمْ عَذَابًۭا مُّهِينًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	those	who	trouble	Allah	and	His	
Noble	Messenger	–	upon	them	is	Allah’s	
curse	in	the	world	and	in	the	Hereafter,	
and	Allah	has	kept	prepared	a	disgraceful	
punishment	for	them.	(To	disrespect	/	
trouble	the	Holy	Prophet	–	peace	and	
blessings	be	upon	him	–	is	blasphemy.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	jo	iƶā	dete	haiñ	Allāh	aur	us	ke	
Rasool	ko	un	par	Allāh	ki	l'anat	hai	duniyā	
aur	āakhirat	meiñ	aur	Allāh	ne	un	ke	liye	
ƶillat	ka	'aƶāb	tayyār	kar	rakhā	hai.

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ يُؤْذُونَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنَـٰتِ بِغَيْرِ مَا ٱكْتَسَبُوا۟ فَقَدِ ٱحْتَمَلُوا۟ بُهْتَـٰنًۭا وَإِثْمًۭا مُّبِينًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	those	who	unnecessarily	harass	
Muslim	men	and	women,	have	burdened	
themselves	with	slander	and	open	sin.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jo	Imān	wāle	mardoñ	aur	'auratoñ	ko	
be	kiye	satāte	haiñ	unhoñ	ne	bohtān	aur	
khulā	gunāh	apne	sar	liyā.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّبِىُّ قُل لِّأَزْوَٰجِكَ وَبَنَاتِكَ وَنِسَآءِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ يُدْنِينَ عَلَيْهِنَّ مِن جَلَـٰبِيبِهِنَّ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ أَدْنَىٰٓ أَن يُعْرَفْنَ فَلَا يُؤْذَيْنَ ۗ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ غَفُورًۭا رَّحِيمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
O	Prophet!	Command	your	wives	and	
your	daughters	and	the	women	of	the	
Muslims	to	cover	their	faces	with	a	part	of	
their	cloaks;	this	is	closer	to	their	being	
recognised	and	not	being	harassed;	and	Allah	is	Oft	Forgiving,	Most	Merciful.	(It	is	incumbent	
upon	women	to	cover	themselves	properly.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Nabi	apni	Bibiyoñ	aur	Sāḥibzādiyoñ	
aur	Musalmānoñ	ki	'auratoñ	se	farmā	do	
ke	apni	chādaroñ	ka	aik	ḥissa	apne	muñh	par	dale	raheñ	ye	is	se	nazdeek	tar	hai	ke	un	ki	
pahchān	ho	to	satāyi	na	jāyeñ	aur	Allāh	bakhsh	ne	wālā	maherbān	hai.

arabicText: ۞ لَّئِن لَّمْ يَنتَهِ ٱلْمُنَـٰفِقُونَ وَٱلَّذِينَ فِى قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٌۭ وَٱلْمُرْجِفُونَ فِى ٱلْمَدِينَةِ لَنُغْرِيَنَّكَ بِهِمْ ثُمَّ لَا يُجَاوِرُونَكَ فِيهَآ إِلَّا قَلِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
If	the	hypocrites,	and	those	in	whose	hearts	is	a	disease,	and	the	rumour	mongers	in	Medinah	
do	not	desist,	We	shall	then	surely	empower	you	against	them,	so	then	they	will	not	remain	
your	neighbours	in	Medinah	except	for	a	few	days.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Agar	bāz	na	āaye	munāfiq	aur	jin	ke	diloñ	meiñ	rog	hai	aur	Madine	meiñ	jhoot	udāne	wāle	to	
zaror	Ham	tumheñ	un	par	shah	(ḥousla)	deñ	ge	phir	wo	Madine	meiñ	tumhāre	pās	na	raheñ	ge	
magar	thode	din.

arabicText: مَّلْعُونِينَ ۖ أَيْنَمَا ثُقِفُوٓا۟ أُخِذُوا۟ وَقُتِّلُوا۟ تَقْتِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText: Accursed	–	to	be	caught	wherever	found	and	to	be	slain	thoroughly.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phatkāre	huye	jahāñ	kahiñ	mileñ	pakde	jāyeñ	aur	gin	gin	kar	qatl	kiye	jāyeñ.

arabicText: سُنَّةَ ٱللَّهِ فِى ٱلَّذِينَ خَلَوْا۟ مِن قَبْلُ ۖ وَلَن تَجِدَ لِسُنَّةِ ٱللَّهِ تَبْدِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
The	tradition	of	Allah	prevalent	among	those	who	passed	away	before;	and	you	will	never	find	
the	traditions	of	Allah	changing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh	ka	dastoor	chalā	āatā	hai	un	logoñ	meiñ	jo	pahle	guzar	gaye	aur	tum	Allāh	ka	dastoor	
hargiz	badltā	na	pāōge

arabicText: يَسْـَٔلُكَ ٱلنَّاسُ عَنِ ٱلسَّاعَةِ ۖ قُلْ إِنَّمَا عِلْمُهَا عِندَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَمَا يُدْرِيكَ لَعَلَّ ٱلسَّاعَةَ تَكُونُ قَرِيبًا
englishTranslationText:
People	ask	you	regarding	the	Last	Day;	
proclaim,	“Its	knowledge	is	only	with	
Allah;	and	what	do	you	know,	the	Last	Day	
may	really	be	near!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Log	tum	se	Qiyāmat	ko	pochte	haiñ	tum	
farmāō	is	ka	'Ilm	to	Allāh	hi	ke	pās	hai	aur	
tum	kiyā	jāno	shāyad	Qiyāmat	pās	hi	ho.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَعَنَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ وَأَعَدَّ لَهُمْ سَعِيرًا
englishTranslationText:
Allah	has	indeed	cursed	the	disbelievers,	
and	has	kept	prepared	for	them	a	blazing	
fire.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	Allāh	ne	kāfiroñ	par	l'anat	
farmāyi	aur	un	ke	liye	bhadakti	āag	tayyār		
kar	rakhi	hai.

arabicText: خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدًۭا ۖ لَّا يَجِدُونَ وَلِيًّۭا وَلَا نَصِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
In	which	they	will	remain	forever;	in	it	
they	will	find	neither	a	protector	nor	any	
supporter.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	meiñ	hamesha	raheñ	ge	us	meiñ	na	
koyi	ḥimāyati	pāyeñ	ge	na	madadgār.

arabicText: يَوْمَ تُقَلَّبُ وُجُوهُهُمْ فِى ٱلنَّارِ يَقُولُونَ يَـٰلَيْتَنَآ أَطَعْنَا ٱللَّهَ وَأَطَعْنَا ٱلرَّسُولَا۠
englishTranslationText:
On	the	day	when	their	faces	will	be	
overturned	being	roasted	inside	the	fire,	
they	will	say,	“Alas	–	if	only	we	had	
obeyed	Allah	and	obeyed	His	Noble	
Messenger!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jis	din	un	ke	muñh	ulat	ulat	kar	āag	meiñ	
tale	jāyeñ	ge	kahte	hoñ	ge	hāye	kisi	ṭaraḥ	
ham	ne	Allāh	ka	ḥukm	mānā	hotā	aur	
Rasool	ka	ḥukm	mānā	hotā.

arabicText: وَقَالُوا۟ رَبَّنَآ إِنَّآ أَطَعْنَا سَادَتَنَا وَكُبَرَآءَنَا فَأَضَلُّونَا ٱلسَّبِيلَا۠
englishTranslationText:
And	they	will	say,	“Our	Lord!	We	followed	
our	chiefs	and	our	elders	–	so	they	misled	
us	from	the	path!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kaheñ	ge	aey	hamāre	Rab	ham	apne	
sardāroñ	aur	apne	badoñ	ke	kahne	par	
chale	to	unhoñ	ne	hameñ	rāh	se	bahkā	
diyā.

arabicText: رَبَّنَآ ءَاتِهِمْ ضِعْفَيْنِ مِنَ ٱلْعَذَابِ وَٱلْعَنْهُمْ لَعْنًۭا كَبِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
“Our	Lord!	Give	them	double	the	
punishment	of	the	fire	and	send	upon	
them	a	mighty	curse!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	hamāre	Rab	unheñ	āag	ka	doonā	
(dugnā)	'aƶāb	de	aur	un	par	badi	l'anat	
kar.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لَا تَكُونُوا۟ كَٱلَّذِينَ ءَاذَوْا۟ مُوسَىٰ فَبَرَّأَهُ ٱللَّهُ مِمَّا قَالُوا۟ ۚ وَكَانَ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ وَجِيهًۭا
englishTranslationText:
O	People	who	Believe!	Do	not	be	like	the	
people	who	troubled	Moosa	–	so	Allah	
freed	him	from	the	allegations	they	had	
uttered;	and	Moosa	is	honourable	in	the	
sight	of	Allah.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	imān	wālo	un	jaise	na	honā	jinhoñ	ne	
Mūsā	ko	satāyā	to	Allāh	ne	usey	bari	
farmā	diyā	us	bāt	se	jo	unhoñ	ne	kahi	aur	
Mūsā	Allāh	ke	yahāñ	āabro	wālā	hai.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَقُولُوا۟ قَوْلًۭا سَدِيدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
O	People	who	Believe!	Fear	Allah,	and	
speak	rightly.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Imān	wālo	Allāh	se	daro	aur	seedhi	
bāt	kaho.

arabicText: يُصْلِحْ لَكُمْ أَعْمَـٰلَكُمْ وَيَغْفِرْ لَكُمْ ذُنُوبَكُمْ ۗ وَمَن يُطِعِ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ فَقَدْ فَازَ فَوْزًا عَظِيمًا
englishTranslationText:
He	will	rectify	your	deeds	for	you	and	forgive	you	your	sins;	and	whoever	obeys	Allah	and	His	
Noble	Messenger,	has	indeed	achieved	a	great	success.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tumhāre	a'amāl	tumhāre	liye	sañwār	
degā	aur	tumhāre	gunāh	bakhsh	degā	aur	
jo	Allāh	aur	us	ke	Rasool	ki	farmān	
bardāri	kare	us	ne	badi	kāmyābi	pāyi.

arabicText: إِنَّا عَرَضْنَا ٱلْأَمَانَةَ عَلَى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَٱلْجِبَالِ فَأَبَيْنَ أَن يَحْمِلْنَهَا وَأَشْفَقْنَ مِنْهَا وَحَمَلَهَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ ظَلُومًۭا جَهُولًۭا
englishTranslationText:
We	indeed	offered	the	trust	to	the	heavens	and	the	earth	and	the	mountains,	but	they	refused	it	
and	were	afraid	of	it	-	and	man	accepted	it;	indeed	he	is	one	who	puts	himself	into	hardship,	is	
extremely	unwise.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	ham	ne	amānat	pesh	farmāyi	āasmānoñ	aur	zameen	aur	phādoñ	par	to	unhoñ	ne	us	ke	
uthāne	se	inkār	kiyā	aur	us	se	dar	gaye	aur	āadmi	ne	uthā	li	be-shak	woh	apni	jān	ko	mashaqqat	
meiñ	dalne	wālā	badā	nādān	hai.

arabicText: لِّيُعَذِّبَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْمُنَـٰفِقِينَ وَٱلْمُنَـٰفِقَـٰتِ وَٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ وَٱلْمُشْرِكَـٰتِ وَيَتُوبَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَى ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنَـٰتِ ۗ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ غَفُورًۭا رَّحِيمًۢا
englishTranslationText:
In	order	that	Allah	may	punish	the	hypocrite	men,	and	the	hypocrite	women,	and	the	
polytheist	men,	and	the	polytheist	women	–	and	accept	the	repentance	of	believing	men	and	
believing	women;	and	Allah	is	Oft	Forgiving,	Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tākay	Allāh	ázāb	de	munāfiq	murdoñ	aur	munāfiq	'auratoñ	aur	mushrik	mardoñ	aur	mushrik	
'auratoñ	ko	aur	Allāh	taubā	qubool	farmāye	Musalmān	mardoñ	aur	Musalmān	'auratoñ	ki	aur	
Allāh	bakhsh	ne	wālā	maherbān	hai.

arabicText: ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِى لَهُۥ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَهُ ٱلْحَمْدُ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْحَكِيمُ ٱلْخَبِيرُ
englishTranslationText:
All	praise	is	to	Allah	–	to	Him	only	
belongs	all	whatever	is	in	the	heavens	
and	all	whatever	is	in	the	earth	–	and	His	
is	the	praise	in	the	Hereafter;	and	He	is	
the	Wise,	the	All	Aware.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Sab	khoobiyāñ	Allāh	ko	ke	usi	ka	māl	hai	
jo	kuchh	āasmānoñ	meiñ	hai	aur	jo	kuchh	
zameen	meiñ	aur	āakhirat	meiñ	usi	ki	
ta’arif	hai	aur	wohi	ḥikmat	wālā	khabar
dār	jānta	hai.

arabicText: يَعْلَمُ مَا يَلِجُ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا يَخْرُجُ مِنْهَا وَمَا يَنزِلُ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَمَا يَعْرُجُ فِيهَا ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلرَّحِيمُ ٱلْغَفُورُ
englishTranslationText:
He	knows	all	that	goes	into	the	earth	and	
all	that	comes	out	of	it,	and	all	that	
descends	from	the	skies	and	all	that	
ascends	into	it;	and	only	He	is	the	Most	
Merciful,	the	Oft	Forgiving.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jo	kuchh	zameen	meiñ	jātā	hai	aur	jo	
kuchh	zameen	se	nikaltā	hai	aur	jo	
āasmān	se	utartā	hai	aur	jo	us	meiñ	
chadhtā	hai	aur	wohi	hai	maherbān	
bakhshish	wālā.

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَا تَأْتِينَا ٱلسَّاعَةُ ۖ قُلْ بَلَىٰ وَرَبِّى لَتَأْتِيَنَّكُمْ عَـٰلِمِ ٱلْغَيْبِ ۖ لَا يَعْزُبُ عَنْهُ مِثْقَالُ ذَرَّةٍۢ فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَلَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَآ أَصْغَرُ مِن ذَٰلِكَ وَلَآ أَكْبَرُ إِلَّا فِى كِتَـٰبٍۢ مُّبِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	disbelievers	said,	“The	Last	Day	
will	never	come	upon	us”;	proclaim,	
“Surely	yes,	why	not?	By	oath	of	my	Lord,	
it	will	surely	come	upon	you	-	the	All	
Knowing	of	the	hidden;	nothing	is	hidden	
from	Him	-	equal	to	an	atom	or	less	than	it	
or	greater	-	in	the	heavens	or	in	the	earth,	
but	it	is	in	a	clear	Book.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kāfir	bole	ham	par	Qiyāmat	na	āaye	gi	
tum	farmāō	kiyuñ	nahiñ	mere	Rab	ki	
qasam	be-shak	zaror	tum	par	āaye	gi	
ghaib	jānne	wālā	us	se	ghāib	nahiñ	ƶarra	
bhar	koyi	cheez	āasmānoñ	meiñ	aur	na	
zameen		meiñ	aur	na	us	se	choti	na	badi	
magar	aik	sāf	batāne	wāli	kitāb	meiñ	hai.

arabicText: لِّيَجْزِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُم مَّغْفِرَةٌۭ وَرِزْقٌۭ كَرِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
So	that	He	may	reward	those	who	
believed	and	did	good	deeds;	it	is	these	
for	whom	is	forgiveness,	and	an	
honourable	sustenance.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tākay	sila	de	unheñ	jo	imān	lāye	aur	achche	kām	kiye	ye	haiñ	jinke	liye	bakhshish	hai	aur	'Izzat	
ki	rozi.

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ سَعَوْ فِىٓ ءَايَـٰتِنَا مُعَـٰجِزِينَ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌۭ مِّن رِّجْزٍ أَلِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	those	who	strove	in	Our	signs	in	
order	to	defeat	–	for	them	is	a	punishment	from	the	severe	painful	punishments.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jinhoñ	ne	Hamāri	Āayatoñ	meiñ	harāne	ki	koshish	ki	un	ke	liye	sakht	'aƶāb	dard-nāk	meiñ	
se	ázāb	hai.

arabicText: وَيَرَى ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْعِلْمَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أُنزِلَ إِلَيْكَ مِن رَّبِّكَ هُوَ ٱلْحَقَّ وَيَهْدِىٓ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطِ ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلْحَمِيدِ
englishTranslationText:
And	those	who	received	the	knowledge	know	that	what	is	sent	down	upon	you	from	your	Lord	
is	the	truth,	and	it	shows	the	path	of	the	Most	Honourable,	the	Most	Praiseworthy.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jinheñ	'Ilm	milā	woh	jānte	haiñ	ke	jo	kuch	tumhāi	ṭaraf	tumhāre	Rab	ke	pās	se	utrā	wohi	
ḥaq	hai	aur	'izzat	wāle	sab	khoobiyoñ	sarāhe	ki	rāh	batātā	hai.

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ هَلْ نَدُلُّكُمْ عَلَىٰ رَجُلٍۢ يُنَبِّئُكُمْ إِذَا مُزِّقْتُمْ كُلَّ مُمَزَّقٍ إِنَّكُمْ لَفِى خَلْقٍۢ جَدِيدٍ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	disbelievers	said,	“Shall	we	show	you	a	man	who	will	tell	you	that	‘When	you	have	
disintegrated	into	the	smallest	pieces,	you	are	to	be	created	again’?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kāfir	bole	kiyā	ham	tumheñ	aisā	mard	batā	deñ	jo	tumheñ	khabar	de	ke	jab	tum	purze	ho	
kar	bilkul	reza	reza	ho	jāō	to	phir	tumheñ	nayā	bannā	hai.

arabicText: أَفْتَرَىٰ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًا أَم بِهِۦ جِنَّةٌۢ ۗ بَلِ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ فِى ٱلْعَذَابِ وَٱلضَّلَـٰلِ ٱلْبَعِيدِ
englishTranslationText:
“Has	he	fabricated	a	lie	against	Allah,	or	is	
he	insane?”	Rather	those	who	disbelieve	
in	the	Hereafter	are	in	the	punishment	
and	extreme	error.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kiyā	Allāh	par	us	ne	jhoot	bāñdhā	ya	use	
saudā	(junoon)	hai	balke	woh	jo	āakhirat	
par	Imān	nahiñ	lāte	'aƶāb	aur	door	ki	
gumrāhi	meiñ	haiñ.

arabicText: أَفَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ إِلَىٰ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ إِن نَّشَأْ نَخْسِفْ بِهِمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ أَوْ نُسْقِطْ عَلَيْهِمْ كِسَفًۭا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةًۭ لِّكُلِّ عَبْدٍۢ مُّنِيبٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
So	did	they	not	see	what	is	before	them	
and	what	is	behind	them	in	the	sky	and	
the	earth?	If	We	will,	We	can	bury	them	
into	the	earth	or	cause	a	part	of	the	sky	to	
fall	on	them;	indeed	in	this	is	a	sign	for	
every	repentant	bondman.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	kiyā	unhoñ	ne	na	dekhā	jo	un	ke	āage	
aur	pichhe		hai	āasmān	aur	zameen		ham	
chāheñ	to	unheñ	zameen	meiñ	dhansā	
deñ	yā	un	par	āasmān	ka	tukdā	girā	deñ	
be-shak	is	meiñ	nishāni	hai	har	ruju'a	lāne	
wāle	bande	ke	liye.

arabicText: ۞ وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا دَاوُۥدَ مِنَّا فَضْلًۭا ۖ يَـٰجِبَالُ أَوِّبِى مَعَهُۥ وَٱلطَّيْرَ ۖ وَأَلَنَّا لَهُ ٱلْحَدِيدَ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	gave	Dawud	the	utmost	
excellence	from	Us;	“O	the	hills	and	birds,	
repent	towards	Allah	along	with	him”;	and	
We	made	iron	soft	for	him.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	hamne	Dāwood	ko	apnā	badā	
fazl	diyā	aey	pahādo	us	ke	sāth	Allāh	ki	
ṭaraf	ruju'	karo	aur	aey	parindo	aur	ham	
ne	us	ke	liye	lohā	narm	kiyā.

arabicText: أَنِ ٱعْمَلْ سَـٰبِغَـٰتٍۢ وَقَدِّرْ فِى ٱلسَّرْدِ ۖ وَٱعْمَلُوا۟ صَـٰلِحًا ۖ إِنِّى بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
“Make	large	coats	of	armour	and	keep	
proper	measure	while	making;	and	all	of	
you	perform	good	deeds;	I	am	indeed	
seeing	your	deeds.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ki	wasi'a	zirheñ	banā	aur	banane	meiñ	
andāze	ka	liḥāz	rakh	aur	tum	sab	neki	
karo	be-shak	maiñ	tumhāre	kām	dekh	
rahā	hoñ.

arabicText: وَلِسُلَيْمَـٰنَ ٱلرِّيحَ غُدُوُّهَا شَهْرٌۭ وَرَوَاحُهَا شَهْرٌۭ ۖ وَأَسَلْنَا لَهُۥ عَيْنَ ٱلْقِطْرِ ۖ وَمِنَ ٱلْجِنِّ مَن يَعْمَلُ بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ بِإِذْنِ رَبِّهِۦ ۖ وَمَن يَزِغْ مِنْهُمْ عَنْ أَمْرِنَا نُذِقْهُ مِنْ عَذَابِ ٱلسَّعِيرِ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	gave	the	wind	in	Sulaiman’s	
control	–	its	morning	journey	equal	to	a	
month’s	course	and	the	evening	journey	
equal	to	a	month’s	course;	and	We	sprung	
a	stream	of	molten	copper	for	him;	and	
from	the	jinns,	who	worked	before	him	by	
the	command	of	his	Lord;	and	those	
among	them	who	turned	away	from	Our	
command	-	We	shall	make	them	taste	the	
punishment	of	the	blazing	fire.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Sulaimāṇ	ke	bas	meiñ	hawā	kar	di	us	
ki	subaḥ	ki	manzil	aik	mahine	ki	rāh	aur	
sham	ki	manzil	aik	mahine	ki	rāh	aur	ham	
ne	us	ke	liye	pighle	huyē	tāñbe	ka	
chashma	bahāyā	aur	jinnoñ	meiñ	se	woh	
jo	us	ke	āage	kām	karte	us	ke	Rab	ke	
ḥukm	se	aur	jo	un	meiñ	hamāre	ḥukm	se	
phire	ham	use	bhadakti	āag	ka	'aƶāb	chakhāyeñ	ge.

arabicText: يَعْمَلُونَ لَهُۥ مَا يَشَآءُ مِن مَّحَـٰرِيبَ وَتَمَـٰثِيلَ وَجِفَانٍۢ كَٱلْجَوَابِ وَقُدُورٍۢ رَّاسِيَـٰتٍ ۚ ٱعْمَلُوٓا۟ ءَالَ دَاوُۥدَ شُكْرًۭا ۚ وَقَلِيلٌۭ مِّنْ عِبَادِىَ ٱلشَّكُورُ
englishTranslationText:
They	made	for	him	whatever	he	wished	-	
synagogues	and	statues,	basins	like	ponds,	and	large	pots	built	into	the	ground;	“Be	thankful,	O	
the	people	of	Dawud!”	And	few	among	My	bondmen	are	grateful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	ke	liye	banāte	jo	woh	chāhtā	ooñche	ooñche	maḥal	aur	taswireñ	aur	bade	ḥauzoñ	ke	barābar	
lagan	aur	langar	dār	dengeñ	aey	Dāwood	wālo	shukr	karo	aur	mere	bandoñ	meiñ	kam	haiñ	
shukr	wāle.

arabicText: فَلَمَّا قَضَيْنَا عَلَيْهِ ٱلْمَوْتَ مَا دَلَّهُمْ عَلَىٰ مَوْتِهِۦٓ إِلَّا دَآبَّةُ ٱلْأَرْضِ تَأْكُلُ مِنسَأَتَهُۥ ۖ فَلَمَّا خَرَّ تَبَيَّنَتِ ٱلْجِنُّ أَن لَّوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ ٱلْغَيْبَ مَا لَبِثُوا۟ فِى ٱلْعَذَابِ ٱلْمُهِينِ
englishTranslationText:
So	when	We	sent	the	command	of	death	towards	him,	no	one	revealed	his	death	to	the	jinns	
except	the	termite	of	the	earth	which	ate	his	staff;	and	when	he	came	to	the	ground,	the	truth	
about	the	jinns	was	exposed	-	if	they	had	known	the	hidden,	they	would	not	have	remained	in	
the	disgraceful	toil.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	ham	ne	us	par	maut	ka	ḥukm	bhejā	jinnoñ	ko	us	ki	Maut	na	batāyi	magar	zameen	ki	
dimak	ne	ke	us	ka	'asā	khāti	thi	phir	jab	Sulaimān	zameen		par	āayā	jinnoñ	ki	ḥaqiqat	khul	gayi	
agar	ghaib	jānte	hote	to	is	khwāri	ke	'aƶāb	meiñ	na	hote

arabicText: لَقَدْ كَانَ لِسَبَإٍۢ فِى مَسْكَنِهِمْ ءَايَةٌۭ ۖ جَنَّتَانِ عَن يَمِينٍۢ وَشِمَالٍۢ ۖ كُلُوا۟ مِن رِّزْقِ رَبِّكُمْ وَٱشْكُرُوا۟ لَهُۥ ۚ بَلْدَةٌۭ طَيِّبَةٌۭ وَرَبٌّ غَفُورٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	for	(the	tribe	of)	Saba	was	a	sign	in	
their	dwelling-place	-	two	gardens	on	the	
right	and	the	left;	“Eat	the	sustenance	
provided	by	your	Lord	and	be	grateful	to	
Him”;	a	pure	land	and	an	Oft	Forgiving	
Lord!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	Sabā	ke	liye	un	ki	āabādi	meiñ	
nishāni	thi	do	bāgh	dāhine	aur	bāyeñ	apne	
Rab	ka	rizq	khāō	aur	us	ka	shukr	adā	karo	
pākiza	shahar	bakhsh	ne	wālā	Rab.

arabicText: فَأَعْرَضُوا۟ فَأَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ سَيْلَ ٱلْعَرِمِ وَبَدَّلْنَـٰهُم بِجَنَّتَيْهِمْ جَنَّتَيْنِ ذَوَاتَىْ أُكُلٍ خَمْطٍۢ وَأَثْلٍۢ وَشَىْءٍۢ مِّن سِدْرٍۢ قَلِيلٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
In	response	they	turned	away	-	We	
therefore	sent	upon	them	a	tremendous	
flood,	and	in	exchange	of	their	two	
gardens	gave	them	two	gardens	bearing	
bitter	fruit,	and	tamarisk,	and	some	
berries.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	unhoñ	ne	muñh	pherā	to	ham	ne	un	
par	zor	ka	ahlā	(sailāb)	bhejā	aur	un	ke	
bāghoñ	ke	'iwaz	do	bāgh	unheñ	badal	diye	
jin	meiñ	buktā	mewa	aur	jhāō	(jhādi)	aur	
kuchh	thodi	si	beriyāñ.

arabicText: ذَٰلِكَ جَزَيْنَـٰهُم بِمَا كَفَرُوا۟ ۖ وَهَلْ نُجَـٰزِىٓ إِلَّا ٱلْكَفُورَ
englishTranslationText:
We	gave	them	this	reward	–	the	
recompense	of	their	ingratitude;	and	
whom	do	We	punish,	except	the	
ungrateful?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ham	ne	unheñ	ye	badla	diyā	un	ki	nā
shukri	ki	sazā	aur	ham	kise	sazā	dete	haiñ	
usi	ko	jo	nā-shukrā	hai.

arabicText: وَجَعَلْنَا بَيْنَهُمْ وَبَيْنَ ٱلْقُرَى ٱلَّتِى بَـٰرَكْنَا فِيهَا قُرًۭى ظَـٰهِرَةًۭ وَقَدَّرْنَا فِيهَا ٱلسَّيْرَ ۖ سِيرُوا۟ فِيهَا لَيَالِىَ وَأَيَّامًا ءَامِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	had	made	several	towns	upon	the	
road	between	them	and	the	towns	which	
We	had	blessed	–	and	kept	them	
according	to	the	length	of	the	journey;	
“Travel	safely	in	them,	by	night	and	by	
day.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Hum	ne	kiye	the	un	meiñ	aur	un	
shahroñ	meiñ	jin	meiñ	ham	ne	barkat	
rakhi	sar-e-rāh	kitne	shahar	aur	unheñ	
manzil	ke	andāze	par	rakhā	un	meiñ	chalo	
rātoñ	aur	dinoñ	amn-o-amān	se.

arabicText: فَقَالُوا۟ رَبَّنَا بَـٰعِدْ بَيْنَ أَسْفَارِنَا وَظَلَمُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ فَجَعَلْنَـٰهُمْ أَحَادِيثَ وَمَزَّقْنَـٰهُمْ كُلَّ مُمَزَّقٍ ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍۢ لِّكُلِّ صَبَّارٍۢ شَكُورٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
So	they	said,	“Our	Lord!	Make	the	stage	
between	our	journeys	longer”	and	they	
wronged	themselves	–	We	therefore	
turned	them	into	fables	and	scattered	
them	completely	with	adversity;	indeed	in	
this	are	signs	for	every	greatly	enduring,	
most	grateful	person.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	bole	aey	hamāre	Rab	hameñ	safar	meiñ	
doori	dāl	aur	unhoñ	ne	khud	apnā	hi	
nuqsān	kiyā	to	ham	ne	unheñ	kahāniyāñ	
kar	diyā	aur	unheñ	pori	pareshāni	se	
parāganda	kar	diyā	be-shak	is	meiñ	zaror	
nishāniyāñ	haiñ	har	bade	sabr	wāle	shukr	
wāle	ke	liye.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ صَدَّقَ عَلَيْهِمْ إِبْلِيسُ ظَنَّهُۥ فَٱتَّبَعُوهُ إِلَّا فَرِيقًۭا مِّنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	Iblis	made	his	assumptions	regarding	them	seem	true,	so	they	all	followed	him	
except	the	group	of	Muslims.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	iblees	ne	unheñ	apnā	gumān	sach	kar	dikhāyā	to	wo	us	ke	pichhe		ho	liye	magar	aik	
giroh	ke	Musalmān	tha.

arabicText: وَمَا كَانَ لَهُۥ عَلَيْهِم مِّن سُلْطَـٰنٍ إِلَّا لِنَعْلَمَ مَن يُؤْمِنُ بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ مِمَّنْ هُوَ مِنْهَا فِى شَكٍّۢ ۗ وَرَبُّكَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ حَفِيظٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	Satan	had	no	control	over	them	at	all,	except	that	We	willed	to	reveal	as	to	who	believes	in	
the	Hereafter	and	who	is	in	doubt	of	it;	and	your	Lord	is	a	Guardian	over	all	things.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	shaiṭān	ka	un	par	kuchh	qāboo	na	thā	magar	is	liye	ke	ham	dikhā	deñ	ke	kaun	āakhirat	par	
Imān	lātā	hai	aur	kaun	is	se	shak	meiñ	hai	aur	tumhārā	Rab	har	chiz	par	nigahbān	hai.

arabicText: قُلِ ٱدْعُوا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ زَعَمْتُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ لَا يَمْلِكُونَ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍۢ فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَلَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا لَهُمْ فِيهِمَا مِن شِرْكٍۢ وَمَا لَهُۥ مِنْهُم مِّن ظَهِيرٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	“Call	those	whom	you	assume	(as	Gods)	besides	Allah”;	they	do	not	own	anything	
equal	even	to	an	atom	either	in	the	heavens	or	in	the	earth,	nor	do	they	have	any	share	in	them,	
nor	is	any	one	among	them	an	aide	to	Allah.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāō	pukāro	unheñ	jinheñ	Allāh	ke	siwā	samjhe	baithe	ho	aur	woh	ƶarra	bhar	ke	mālik	
nahiñ	āasmānoñ	meiñ	aur	na	zameen	meiñ	aur	na	un	ka	in	donoñ	meiñ	kuch	ḥissa	aur	na	Allāh	
ka	un	meiñ	se	koyi	madadgār.

arabicText: وَلَا تَنفَعُ ٱلشَّفَـٰعَةُ عِندَهُۥٓ إِلَّا لِمَنْ أَذِنَ لَهُۥ ۚ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا فُزِّعَ عَن قُلُوبِهِمْ قَالُوا۟ مَاذَا قَالَ رَبُّكُمْ ۖ قَالُوا۟ ٱلْحَقَّ ۖ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَلِىُّ ٱلْكَبِيرُ
englishTranslationText:
And	intercession	does	not	benefit	before	
Him,	except	for	one	whom	He	permits;	to	
the	extent	that	when	the	fear	is	removed	
from	their	hearts	by	giving	permission,	
they	say	to	each	other,	“How	splendidly	
has	your	Lord	spoken!”	They	say,	“All	that	
He	has	proclaimed	is	the	Truth;	and	He	is	
the	Supreme,	the	Great.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	ke	pās	shafā'at	kām	nahiñ	deti	
magar	jis	ke	liye	woh	iƶn	farmāye	yahāñ	
tak	ke	jab	iƶn	de	kar	un	ke	diloñ	ki	
ghabrāhat	door	farmā	di	jāti	hai	aik	dosre	
se	kahte	haiñ	tumhāre	Rab	ne	kiyā	hi	bāt	
farmādyi	wo	kahte	haiñ	jo	farmāyā	ḥaq	
farmāyā	aur	wohi	hai	buland	badāyi	wālā.
